name: Lion
description: Lions, the mighty kings of the animal kingdom, have golden fur and loud roars.

name: Deer
description: A deer is a large wild animal that eats grass and leaves. A male deer usually has large, branching horns.

name: Elephant
description: Elephants are the world's largest land mammals, with males weighing up to six tonnes on average

name: Horse
description: Horse have four powerful legs, two eyes, a nose, ears and a tail.

name: Monkey
description: Monkeys are very agile and intelligent animals. Monkeys are intelligent and playful, They can jump from one tree

name: Cheetah
description: Fastest land animal (but not a reptile - it's actually a big cat!)
funFact: They can go from 0 to 60 mph in 3 seconds!

name: Zebra
description: Zebras are herbivorous animals that belong to the equine family,.

name: Fox
description: Foxes are small to medium-sized, omnivorous mammals belonging to several genera of the family Canidae.

name: Cow
description: A cow is a large female animal that is kept on farms for its milk

name: Camel
description: Camel is called Ship of Desert.

name: Moose
description: Moose,largest member of the deer family Cervidae.

name: Bear
description: Bears are solitary animals, considered as the most asocial among all carnivoras.

name: Beluga whale
description: Belugas are small, toothed whales.

name: Chimpanzee
description: Chimpanzees are great apes found across central and West Africa.

name: Dingo
description: The Dingo is Australia's wild dog.

name: Dolphins
description: Dolphins are considered one of the world's most intelligent animals,

name: Gorilla
description: Gorilla is the largest of all apes and is very gentle in nature.

name: Hedgehog
description: Hedgehogs are small mammals that live in the wild in Europe, Africa, and Asia.

name: Hippopotamus
description: Territorial giants, wallowing in muddy rivers.

name: Hyena
description: Hyenas are mammals of Africa and Asia.

name: Jaguar
description: Jaguars are the largest of South America's big cats and the third largest cats in the world.

name: Kangaroo
description: Kangaroos are four marsupials from the family Macropodidae.

name: Koala
description: Koala, tree-dwelling marsupial of coastal eastern and southern Australia.

name: Narwhal
description: Narwhals are a species of whale with a horn.

name: Orangutan
description: Orang-utans are known as gardeners of the forest.

name: Otter
description: Otters are very energetic and playful.

name: Panda
description: The giant panda, a black-and-white bear, has a body typical of bears.

name: Polar Bear
description: Polar bear, great white northern bear found throughout the Arctic region.

name: Rhinoceros
description: Rhinoceroses are large, heavy animals.

name: Seal
description: Seals are a group of three families and 33 species of web-footed aquatic mammals.

name: Sloth
description: Sloths live in the tropical forests of Central and South America.

name: Wolf
description: wolf, any of two species of wild doglike carnivores.

name: Baboon
description: Baboons belong to a large family of Old World monkeys

name: Buffalo
description: Buffalo is one of the most useful animals in the world.

name: Nyala
description: The lowland nyala or simply nyala, is a spiral-horned antelope native to southern Africa.

name: Vizsla
description: The Vizsla is a versatile, red-coated gundog built for long days in the field.

name: Uakari
description: Uakari is the common name for the New World monkeys of the genus Cacajao.

name: Gaur
description: The Indian Bison or Gaur (Bos gaurus) is the tallest species of wild cattle found in India and largest extant bovine.

name: ox
description: a bovine, trained and used as a draft animal.

name: calf
description: A calf is a young domestic cow or bull.

name: zebu
description: Although B. taurus breeds are more precocious, Zebu cattle are extensively used in the tropics, due to their thermo tolerance and resistance to parasites.

name: yak
description: The wild yak (Bos mutus) is a large, wild bovine native to the Himalayas.

name: ferret
description: The ferret is a small, domesticated species belonging to the family Mustelidae

name: Walrus
description: The walrus is a large marine mammal known for its distinctive tusks, flippers, and thick blubber, found primarily in Arctic and sub-Arctic regions.

name: Reindeer
description: They are very docile and trusting animals that live together in large groups and migrate huge distances to find food.

name: Okapi
description: The okapi is a shy animal that lives among dense cover and avoids people.

name: Nilgai
description: Nilgai is the Hindustani word for ‚Äúblue cow,‚Äù which describes the blue-gray of adult bulls.

name: Kudu
description: Kudu, or koodoo, is the Khoikhoi and seTswana name for this antelope.

name: Guanaco
description: The guanaco is a diurnal animal. These small hens live in which one male and many fish live with their children.

name: Bongo
description: bongo, (Tragelaphus eurycerus), the largest, most colourful, and most sociable of the African forest antelopes,

name: Ape Animal
description: Monkeys and apes are both primates, which means they're both part of the human family tree.

name: Anteater
description: Anteaters are curious-looking animals.

name: Ring-tailed lemur
description: The ring-tailed lemur is a strepsirrhine primate, with a protruding muzzle and a wet nose. Top is the skull.

name: Zorse
description: A zorse is the offspring of a zebra stallion and a horse mare.

name: Fennec Fox
description: The fennec fox is the smallest of all the world's foxes, but its large ears, measuring 6 inches, appear to be on loan from a bigger relative.

name: Manatee
description: Manatees are large, fully aquatic, mostly herbivorous marine mammals sometimes known as sea cows.

name: Puma
description: Pumas are large, secretive cats.

name: Siberian Husky
description: The Siberian Husky is a medium-sized working sled dog breed.

name: Chamois
description: A chamois is an animal with brown fur and short horns that curve backwards, native to the mountains of Europe.

name: Star-nosed Mole
description: Star nosed moles are one of the most distinctive types of mammal.

name: Weasel
description: Weasels are mammals of the genus Mustela of the family Mustelidae.

name: Rhinos
description: Like the closely related, and larger, Indian rhinoceros, the Javan rhino has a single horn.

name: Pony
description: A pony is a type of small horse.

name: Wolverine
description: It is a muscular carnivore and a solitary animal.

name: Wildebeest
description: They belong to the family Bovidae, which includes true antelopes, cattle, goats, sheep, and other even-toed horned ungulates.

name: Tapir
description: Tapirus is a genus of tapir which contains the living tapir species.

name: Tarsier
description: Tarsiers are lemurlike in being nocturnal and having a well-developed sense of smell.

name: Sable
description: Sable, graceful member of the weasel family, Mustelidae, found in the forests of northern Asia and highly valued for its fur.

name: Saluki Dog
description: Salukis are swift and agile sprinters who love a good chase.

name: Saola
description: TThe reddish-brown saola is a horned animal that can be found in Asian countries like Laos and Vietnam

name: Serval
description: The serval is a wild cat native to Africa.

name: Aurochs
description: The aurochs (Bos primigenius) is an extinct cattle species, considered to be the wild ancestor of modern domestic cattle

name: Aye Aye
description: Aye-ayes are dark brown or black and are distinguished by a bushy tail that is larger than their body.

name: Asian Palm Civet
description: The Asian Palm Civet is considered a ‚ÄúVulnerable‚Äù animal.

name: Marten
description: Martens are forest-dwelling and usually solitary.

name: Guinea pig
description: Guinea pig, a domesticated species of South American rodent belonging to the cavy family (Caviidae).

name: Gazelle
description: A gazelle is one of many antelope species in the genus Gazella.

name: Indri
description: The indri is a vertical clinger and leaper and thus holds its body upright when traveling through trees or resting in branches.
